title: Thanks for ruining URF
body:
Made it AR to make it balanced. Every game i go in theres a zed, a lucien, a ryze. Im not able to ban them or pick a champion to counter them.

The whole point of URF was supposed to be fun. Not being allowed to pick my champion isn't fun at all. Why would you try to balance a game mode with no mana and 80% CDR.... seriously. Bring back the old URF and give 5 bans per team and make it a custom game mode!

replies.body: As long as ARAM accounts remain a possibility, things like consistency in ARAM modes will remain.

>
> As long as ARAM accounts remain a possibility, things like consistency in ARAM modes will remain.

lol do u even know wut ur trying 2 say mate lol gtfo and go back to school rofl ok

I know exactly what I was saying and worded it appropriately. I didn't say there was complete consistency, just that "things like consistency" remain. Having a smaller and specific champion pool limits what you can get in ARAM. Compared to owning 70+ champions. If I own only Lux, Jhin, and Nautilus, then my "random champion pool" is limited to those three and whichever champions are on free rotation. It may be random, but it's definitely more consistent than it should be.

And, if you're going to try and be offensive by telling me to go back to school, at least use real words, grammar and punctuation.

I just wanted to play AP Nasus and Amumu on urf. . . . 
haven't got a chance to yet . . . "fun"

The whole point of URF is supposed to be fun, yes. 
However, fun goes out the window when 99% of the players exploit the mode by picking the same 10 champions every game. They turn it into a "*Pick one of these champs of you don't get to have fun.*" At least in ARURF, you get champion diversity and a chance to actually play different champions and not get totally obliterated 99% of the time because you didn't pick Evelynn and they did. I'd take going against those URF OP champs 50% of the time rather than 99% of the time.
